column5: I know bass season is not here yet but I was getting a few of my trays ready.  I fish Simcoe quite a bit and unlike most bass anglers, I only throw tubes about 17% of the time.  I would guess that I have a crankbait tied to my line 75% of the time.  Anyone want to guess what colour I use?  Have a look at the pic Scary thing is that those aren't even all my crayfish coloured cranks.
i'm just a little envious of your stash of wiggle warts  darn i love those lures...wallies also luv 'em
Whats that top left one? I rarely throw crank baits.Mostly tubes and jerk baits and spinnerbaits.  Nice collection.
Me too. I use only tubes, grubs and spinner baits. The only time I will use stick baits for smallies is in the fall on georgian bay. I have a few of those and will give them a shot!!!
wow nice collection, its huge compared to mine lol

This is a BPS lure called the egg.  All I am going to say is go out and get one.   Mike, You have some quality lures there.  You've been watching JP and Dave quite a bit I see. As I said earlier, that collection that I have posted is only my crayfish coloured lures, and not even all the crayfish coloured ones I own.  I also have that many cranks in silver and white and again in chartreuse and perch colours.  It is gross when I think how much $$ has been spent on cranks.

Yep, crankbaits are the crack of bass fishing....sooo many colours, sooo many depths, soooo many different wiggles. I ventured a short way down that road last year only to discover the one-ton jighead.
